t: Psalm 107
Book Five
Let the Redeemed of the Lord Say So
Oh*pn give thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good, for*ld his steadfast love endures forever!
Let*ln the redeemed of the Lord*s say so, whom*ld he has redeemed from trouble
and*ln gathered in from the lands, from*ld the east and from the west, from*ld the north and from the south.
Some*pn wandered in desert wastes, finding*ld no way to a city to dwell in;
hungry*ln and thirsty, their*ld soul fainted within them.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he delivered them from their distress.
He*ln led them by a straight way till*ld they reached a city to dwell in.
Let*ln them thank the Lord*s for his steadfast love, for*ld his wondrous works to the children of man!
For*ln he satisfies the longing soul, and*ld the hungry soul he fills with good things.
Some*pn sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, prisoners*ld in affliction and in irons,
for*ln they had rebelled against the words of God, and*ld spurned the counsel of the Most High.
So*ln he bowed their hearts down with hard labor; they*ld fell down, with none to help.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he delivered them from their distress.
He*ln brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and*ld burst their bonds apart.
Let*ln them thank the Lord*s for his steadfast love, for*ld his wondrous works to the children of man!
For*ln he shatters the doors of bronze and*ld cuts in two the bars of iron.
Some*pn were fools through their sinful ways, and*ld because of their iniquities suffered affliction;
they*ln loathed any kind of food, and*ld they drew near to the gates of death.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he delivered them from their distress.
He*ln sent out his word and healed them, and*ld delivered them from their destruction.
Let*ln them thank the Lord*s for his steadfast love, for*ld his wondrous works to the children of man!
And*ln let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving, and*ld tell of his deeds in songs of joy!
Some*pn went down to the sea in ships, doing*ld business on the great waters;
they*ln saw the deeds of the Lord,*s his*ld wondrous works in the deep.
For*ln he commanded and raised the stormy wind, which*ld lifted up the waves of the sea.
They*ln mounted up to heaven; they went down to the depths; their*ld courage melted away in their evil plight;
they*ln reeled and staggered like drunken men and*ld were at their witsâ€™ end.
Then*ln they cried to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ld he delivered them from their distress.
He*ln made the storm be still, and*ld the waves of the sea were hushed.
Then*ln they were glad that the waters were quiet, and*ld he brought them to their desired haven.
Let*ln them thank the Lord*s for his steadfast love, for*ld his wondrous works to the children of man!
Let*ln them extol him in the congregation of the people, and*ld praise him in the assembly of the elders.
He*pn turns rivers into a desert, springs*ld of water into thirsty ground,
a*ln fruitful land into a salty waste, because*ld of the evil of its inhabitants.
He*ln turns a desert into pools of water, a*ld parched land into springs of water.
And*ln there he lets the hungry dwell, and*ld they establish a city to live in;
they*ln sow fields and plant vineyards and*ld get a fruitful yield.
By*ln his blessing they multiply greatly, and*ld he does not let their livestock diminish.
When*pn they are diminished and brought low through*ld oppression, evil, and sorrow,
he*ln pours contempt on princes and*ld makes them wander in trackless wastes;
but*ln he raises up the needy out of affliction and*ld makes their families like flocks.
The*ln upright see it and are glad, and*ld all wickedness shuts its mouth.
Whoever*pn is wise, let him attend to these things; let*ld them consider the steadfast love of the Lord.*s
